dsDescriptionValue.value:
The Latinobarometer is an annual survey conducted in 18 Latin American countries. The survey measures public opinions, attitudes and behaviors on topics covering:
Economics and International Trade; Integration and Trade Agreements; Democracy; Politics and Institutions; Civic Culture and Participation; Social Capital; Environment;  and Gender and Gender Discrimination

keywordValue.value: Economics, International Trade, Integration,Democracy, Politics, Political Institutions, Civic Culture, Civic Participation, Social Capital, Environment, Gender, Gender Discrimination

otherGeographicCoverage.value: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Costa Rica, Chile, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Uruguay, Venezuela, Spain
